article.headline: SE Louisiana 54, Nicholls St. 52
article.story: HAMMOND, La. (AP) -- Dekyron Nicks had 13 points and Southeastern Louisiana held off a strong second-half rally by Nicholls State to win 54-52 on Saturday. The Lions (14-11, 6-6 Southland) scored the game's first nine points and led 33-16 at halftime. During that half, Southeastern made 54.5 percent of its shots from the floor and 3 of 9 from 3-point range, while Nicholls managed only 18 percent of its field goal attempts and none of its seven 3-point attempts. Southeastern never trailed. But Nicholls (7-20, 2-10) outscored the Lions 20-6 over the first 11:15 of the second half, including 10 points from Ryan Bathie, who finished with 12. Kevyn Green had 11 points for the Lions. The Colonels were led by 13 points from Anatoly Bose. Justin Payne and Adonis Gray had 12 each.

statistics.name: points
statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.description: Field Goal makes and attempts.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.name: minutes
statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover
